string-array.name: drive_system
string-array.item: Installed Motor Power Per Drive Pulley
Contact Angle for Drive Pulley One
Contact Angle for Drive Pulley Two

string-array.name: field_survey
string-array.item: Is the site governed by MSHA?
If so, it is considered underground or surface?
What is is the shift start time?
Are there any restrictions on daily hours?
Who will the new belt be strung by? Designate just one party.
Who is going to track the new belt once installed? Designate just one party.
Is the conveyor an incline conveyor or a horizontal conveyor?
Is it a gravity or screw takeup?
Is there catwalk on the conveyor?
Is the footage of the conveyor above ground or below ground?
Is the conveyor inside or outside?
Is there equipment on-site to set the belt roll and maneuver necessary equipment?
Is there a manflit on-site that will be accessible if needed?
Is the carrying side of the conveyor accessible?
Is the return side of the conveyor accessible?
Is the tail pulley of the conveyor accessible?
What are the min and max material temps, and ambient temps?

string-array.name: idlers_and_returns
string-array.item: Return Idler Cages and Nip Guards

string-array.name: inspection
string-array.item: Is there edge wear on the belt?
What is the condition of the splice?
has material spilled off the belt
Is there shiny metal where the belt has rubbed the paint and rust off the frame?
Is there paint rubbed off the structure or idlers? Where and how did it get rubbed off?
Is the lagging worn off? Has the lagging gotten hard and sticky?
Is the belting failing where the idlers force it in to an angle?
Is the belt running fast and partially loaded, or slow and fully loaded
Is there carry back? How bad is it?
Have water and abrasive particles been entering cuts and grinding of carcass?
Are there ozone sources...arc welders, electrical generating equipment?
Is oil getting on the belt?
How did the previous belt fail?
How long did the previous belt last?
What was the spec fo the previous belt?
Have the operating and environmental conditions changed?
Is there material built up on pulleys?
Are there any hot or cold repairs made to the belt?
Is the tail pulley free to spin or is there trapped material around it?
Is there damage to the tail pulley?
What is the condition of the skirting in the loading area? Does it need adjustment or replacement?
Is there damage to the impact bed or impact idlers?
Is the slider bed clean and smooth?

Is there damage to the idlers on the carry side? Is there adequate lubrication? Are the idlers numbered for identification? How many and which ones need to be repaired or replaced? Are the defective ones flagged with a plastic ribbon?
What is the operational status of the carry side trainers? Are they tied off?
What is the condition of the skirting and the impact bed or idlers in the secondary loading locations?
Is there damage to the tipper frame?
Is there buildup around the tipper pulley?
Is the head and/or drive clean, does it have work lagging, is the rubber old, worn, smooth, or hard?
Head Pulley Cleaner and Scraper Adjustment
Operational Status of the Takeup Mechanism
Operational or Tied Off Return Self Trainers
Damage to Return Side from Poor Training
Operational Status of Plow or Scraper in front of Tail Pulley
Has all splicing equipment been removed?
Are pulley shafts parallel to each other?
Were belt structure bolts checked for tightness?
Are belt idlers horizontal, in-line and square with conveyor center line?
Have self-training idlers been installed properly?
Is the reducer oil at the proper level?
Was the belt chain guard oiled?
Does the motor have proper rotation?
Were all tools, installation gear and foreign objects removed from the area?
Was the belt gravity takeup blocking removed?
Have belt wipers and skirting been properly adjusted?
Are pulleys an idlers free of material buildup?
Is the takeup carriage in good working order?
Will head and tail pulleys be watched for possible runoff?
Are belt emergency stop cords installed?

string-array.name: pulleys
string-array.item:
PARAMETERS FOR QUOTING A PULLEY…
conveyor id
pulley location
quantity
pulley type
OD without laggling
face width
crown or flat face
lagging thickness
lagging groove
lagging specs
shaft diameter at hub
shaft diameter @ HUB
shaft diameter @ BRG
shaft diameter @ DRIVE
# KW
shaft length
bearning center (BC)
wrap (arc of contact)
T1
T2

TYPES OF PULLEYS...
Pro Duty Drum
Heavy Duty Drum
Mine Duty Drum
Engineered Class Drum
Spiral Drum
EZ Mount
Turbine
Herringbone Wing
Heavy Duty Wing
Mine Duty Wing
Quarry Max Duty Wing
Spiral and Spiral Plus Wing
Grain Herringbone Wing
Boot Herringbone Wing
Single Disc Elevator

TYPES OF LAGGING FOR DRUM PULLEYS…
Herringbone Grove
Chevron Groove
Diamond Groove
Circumfrential Groove
Aligner Groove (Lorig)
Ceramic
Vulcanized Engineered Ceramic
Craft-Lag
Weld in Slide
Hammer in Slide

CROWN TYPES...
Flat Face
Standard Crown Face
High Crown
Edge or End Crown
Trap or Trapezoidal Crown

SHAFT PARAMETERS (DRIVEN AND NON DRIVEN)...
Shaft Length
Rough Diameter
Shaft Diameter
Bearing Diameter
Bearing Center

SHAFT PARAMETERS (DRIVEN)...
Coupling Diameter
Extension
Key Length
Key Size
BackStop Diameter
Extension
Key Length
Key Size
Direction of Rotation

string-array.name: splice_details
string-array.item: Estimated Belt Stretch for this Belt and System
Desired Take Up Position Before Belt Stretch
Desired Take Up Position After Belt Stretch
Nearest Muster Station from Splice Location
Is the customer secretly watching you on camera?
Lockout Details like number of locks and location of panel
What are the answers to the questions on the safe work plan?
Noise level at the splice area
Distance from splice area to ground
